contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=November 2009}} {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Nosegawa |JapaneseName= 野迫川村 |settlement_type=Village |MapImage= Nosegawa in Nara Prefecture.png |Region= [[Kansai region|Kansai]] |Prefecture= [[Nara Prefecture]] |District= [[Yoshino District, Nara|Yoshino District]] |Area_km2= 155.03 |PopDate= October 1, 2007 |Population= 699 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= 34|10|N|135|38 |LatitudeDegrees = 34 |LatitudeMinutes = 10 |LatitudeSeconds = |LongtitudeDegrees = 135 |LongtitudeMinutes = 38 |LongtitudeSeconds = |Tree= Betula platyphylla |Flower= [[Rhododendron]] |Bird= [[Japanese Bush-warbler]] |SymbolImage= |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= 648-0305 |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= 0747-37-2101 |CityHallLink= [http://www.vill.nosegawa.nara.jp/ Village of Nosegawa] }} {{nihongo|'''Nosegawa'''|野迫川村|Nosegawa-mura}} is a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Yoshino District, Nara|Yoshino District]], [[Nara Prefecture|Nara]], [[Japan]]. As of October 1, 2007, the village has an estimated [[population]] of 699. The total area is 155.03 km². ==Geography== Located in southwestern portion of [[Nara Prefecture]], it is surrounded by the [[Kii Mountain Range]]. Mount Natsumushi (1349m) and Mount Arakami (1260m) are two major [[mountains]] in Nosegawa. Many rivers, such as the Iketsu River, run through the village and are eventually united by the Totsukawa River which flows to the [[Pacific Ocean]]. ===Surrounding municipalities=== * [[Nara Prefecture]] ** [[Gojō, Nara|Gojō]] ** [[Totsukawa, Nara|Totsukawa]] * [[Wakayama Prefecture]] ** [[Koya, Wakayama|Kōya]] ** [[Tanabe, Wakayama|Tanabe]] ** [[Katsuragi, Wakayama|Katsuragi]] ** [[Aridagawa, Wakayama|Aridagawa]] ==Education== * [[Primary Schools]] ** Nosegawa Elementary School * [[Junior High Schools]] ** Nosegawa Junior High School ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} * [http://www.vill.nosegawa.nara.jp/ Nosegawa official website] {{ja icon}} {{Nara Prefecture}} [[Category:Villages in Nara Prefecture]] {{Nara-geo-stub}}
